alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 1:03AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Brown, Kewaunee, northeastern Calumet and Manitowoc Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 102 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brillion to 7 miles northeast of Valders to near Cleveland. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Green Bay, Manitowoc, Kewaunee, Pulaski, Algoma, Brillion, Luxemburg, Denmark, Two Creeks and Bellevue Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
